subject: Re: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: Hi, I Changed my Test suite() method to  : public static Test suite(){ TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(); suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class); return
messageBody:
Hi,
I Changed my Test suite() method to :

public static Test suite(){
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
return suite;

Its giving the following compile time error :

TestLanguageVector.java:25: addTest(junit.framework.Test) in
junit.framework.TestSuite cannot be applied to (java.lang.Class)
suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);

What does this say, how should i proceed ...

Regds
chan




On Tuesday 16 September 2003 8:46 pm, Chris Dollin wrote:
> On Tuesday 16 September 2003 16:03, Jason Rogers wrote:
> > Your suite() method is wrong. It should say:
> >
> > public static Test suite(){
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
> > return suite;
> > }
>
> Chan's suite method was:
> > > public static Test suite(){
> > > return new TestSuite("TestLanguageVector.class");
> > > }
>
> There's nothing wrong with it that I can see. "return a test suite with all
> the tests for this class in it", vs your own "make me an empty test suite,
> add to it all the tests of this class, and return the suite".
